Jade_Eagleson:
{{short description|Canadian country singer and songwriter}} {{Use mdy dates|date=January 2021}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = Jade Eagleson | image = | caption = | image_size = | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1994|5|23}} | birth_name = | birth_place = | origin = [[Cavan Monaghan|Bailieboro, Ontario]], [[Canada]] | instrument = | genre = {{hlist|[[Country music|Country]]|[[neotraditional country]]}} | occupation = Singer, songwriter | years_active = 2017-present | label = {{hlist|Starseed|[[Universal Music Canada|Umusic]]}} | associated_acts = | website = {{URL|jadeeagleson.com/}} }} '''Jade Eagleson''' (born May 23, 1994) is a Canadian [[country music|country]] singer and songwriter from [[Bailieboro, Ontario]]. He has released three albums: ''[[Jade Eagleson (album)|Jade Eagleson]]'' (2020), ''[[Honkytonk Revival]]'' (2021), and ''[[Do It Anyway (album)|Do It Anyway]]'' (2023).{{cite web|title=''Jade Eagleson'' – Jade Eagleson|url=https://www.allmusic.com/album/release/jade-eagleson-mr0005257040|work=[[AllMusic]]|access-date=January 10, 2021}} He has also released nine singles, achieving four number one [[Canada Country]] hits with "[[Lucky (Jade Eagleson song)|Lucky]]", "[[All Night to Figure It Out]]", "[[More Drinkin' Than Fishin']]" and "[[She Don't Know]]". ==Early life== Eagleson was born and raised on his grandparents's farm in [[Bailieboro, Ontario]]. He tended crops and raised livestock with his father before initially heading to [[Alberta]] for work at age 19. He then elected to move back to [[Bailieboro, Ontario|Bailieboro]] and pursue a career in [[country music]].{{cite news|title=JADE EAGLESON CELEBRATES MAJOR LABEL DEBUT WITH THE RELEASE OF "GOT YOUR NAME ON IT"|url=http://www.umusic.ca/press-releases/jade-eagleson-celebrates-major-label-debut-release-got-name/|work=[[Universal Music Canada|Umusic]]|date=May 18, 2018}}{{Cite web|url= https://www.thepeterboroughexaminer.com/news/peterborough-region/2017/08/17/country-boy-from-bailieboro-named-boots-and-hearts-emerging-artist.html |title=Country boy from Bailieboro named Boots and Hearts emerging artist|work=[[The Peterborough Examiner]]|date=August 17, 2017|access-date=January 10, 2021}} Eagleson cites [[Paul Brandt]] as one of his biggest musical influences,{{cite web|url=https://www.castanet.net/news/Entertainment/383622/Jade-Eagleson-talks-past-mistakes-musical-inspiration-ahead-of-CCMA-Awards|title=Jade Eagleson talks past mistakes, musical inspiration ahead of CCMA Awards|first=Bill|last=Graveland|date=September 5, 2022|access-date=October 4, 2022|work=[[The Canadian Press]]|publisher=Castanet}} while also viewing [[Alan Jackson]], [[Randy Travis]], [[George Strait]], and [[Shania Twain]] as major idols.{{cite web|url=https://amplifymusicmag.com/jade-eagleson-releases-sophomore-album-honkytonk-revival/|title=JADE EAGLESON releases sophomore album 'Honkytonk Revival'|work=Amplify Music Magazine|date=November 14, 2021 |access-date=October 5, 2022}} ==Career== ===2017–2020: Early career and self-titled album=== In 2017, Eagleson won the Emerging Artist Showcase at the [[Boots and Hearts Music Festival]].{{Cite web|url=https://bootsandhearts.com/jade-eagleson-new-ep/|title=Jade Eagleson – New EP |work=[[Boots and Hearts Music Festival|Boots and Hearts]]|date=October 9, 2018|access-date=January 10, 2021}}{{Cite web|url=https://thereviewsarein.com/2018/08/10/got-your-name-on-it-jade-eagleson-at-boots-hearts-2018/|first=Joshua|last=Murray|title= Got Your Name On It, Jade Eagleson at Boots & Hearts 2018|work=The Reviews Are In|date=August 10, 2018|access-date=January 10, 2021}} In May 2018, Eagleson released "[[Got Your Name on It]]", his debut single on [[Universal Music Canada|Umusic]].{{cite web|title=Jade Eagleson's Debut Single "Got Your Name On It"|url=http://frontporchmusic.ca/music/jade-eaglesons-got-your-name-on-it/|work=Front Porch Music|date=November 10, 2020}} It would peak at #6 on the ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' [[Canada Country]] chart and at #90 on the [[Canadian Hot 100]]. The song has been certified Platinum by [[Music Canada]]. Later that year, Eagleson released his debut self-titled extended play.{{Cite web|url=http://www.umusic.ca/press-releases/jade-eagleson-released-self-titled-debut-ep/|title=JADE EAGLESON RELEASES SELF-TITLED DEBUT EP|work=[[Universal Music Canada|Umusic]]|date=October 9, 2018}}{{Dead link|date=September 2024 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} The EP included Eagleson's second single "[[Count the Ways]]", which was also certified Platinum by Music Canada and peaked at #4 on the Canada Country chart.{{Cite web |url=http://www.umusic.ca/press-releases/country-swooner-jade-eagleson-releases-the-official-music-video-for-count-the-ways-today/ |title=COUNTRY SWOONER JADE EAGLESON RELEASES THE OFFICIAL MUSIC VIDEO FOR "COUNT THE WAYS" TODAY |work=[[Universal Music Canada|Umusic]] |date=April 24, 2019 }}{{Dead link|date=September 2024 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} In October 2019, Eagleson released his third single "[[Lucky (Jade Eagleson song)|Lucky]]".{{Cite web|url=http://www.umusic.ca/press-releases/2019-ccma-rising-star-award-winner-jade-eagleson-releases-new-single-lucky/|title=2019 CCMA RISING STAR AWARD WINNER, JADE EAGLESON RELEASES NEW SINGLE "LUCKY"|work=[[Universal Music Canada|Umusic]]|date=October 5, 2019}}{{cite web|first=Katie|last=Colley|title=Canadian Country Singer Jade Eagleson Debuts Catchy New Song 'Lucky'|url=https://etcanada.com/news/523763/canadian-country-singer-jade-eagleson-debuts-catchy-new-song-lucky/|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20191017003300/https://etcanada.com/news/523763/canadian-country-singer-jade-eagleson-debuts-catchy-new-song-lucky/|url-status=dead|archive-date=October 17, 2019|work=[[Entertainment Tonight Canada|ET Canada]]|date=October 15, 2019}} Eagleson was then awarded "Rising Star" at the 2019 [[Canadian Country Music Association|CCMA Awards]].{{Cite web|url=https://www.thepeterboroughexaminer.com/news/peterborough-region/2019/09/09/bailieboro-s-jade-eagleson-wins-rising-star-award-at-ccma-awards.html|title=Bailieboro's Jade Eagleson wins rising star award at CCMA awards|work=[[The Peterborough Examiner]]|date=September 9, 2019|access-date=January 12, 2021}} "[[Lucky (Jade Eagleson song)|Lucky]]" then became Eagleson's first #1 hit on the Canada Country chart in 2020.{{cite web|first=Katie|last=Colley|title=Jade Eagleson Celebrates 'Lucky' Going No. 1: 'It Still Doesn't Feel Real'|url=https://etcanada.com/news/613949/jade-eagleson-celebrates-lucky-going-no-1-it-still-doesnt-feel-real/|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210121005938/https://etcanada.com/news/613949/jade-eagleson-celebrates-lucky-going-no-1-it-still-doesnt-feel-real/|url-status=dead|archive-date=January 21, 2021|work=[[Entertainment Tonight Canada|ET Canada]]|date=March 24, 2020}}{{Cite web|url= https://thereviewsarein.com/2020/03/16/jade-eagleson-hits-1-for-the-1st-time-with-lucky/|first=Joshua|last=Murray|title=Jade Eagleson Hits #1 for the 1st Time with Lucky|work=The Reviews Are In|date=March 16, 2020}} In April 2020, Eagleson released his fourth single "[[Close (Jade Eagleson song)|Close]]",{{Cite web|url=http://www.umusic.ca/press-releases/jade-eagleson-set-to-release-new-single-close-this-friday/|title=JADE EAGLESON SET TO RELEASE NEW SINGLE "CLOSE" THIS FRIDAY|work=[[Universal Music Canada|Umusic]]|date=April 21, 2020}}{{Dead link|date=September 2024 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} which would peak at #8 on the Canada Country chart, and #88 on the Canadian Hot 100 (a new career high). His debut studio album ''[[Jade Eagleson (album)|Jade Eagleson]]'' was released on July 24, 2020 and included all four of his previous singles.{{Cite web|url=http://www.umusic.ca/press-releases/self-titled-debut-album-from-jade-eagleson-on-track-to-be-most-streamed-album-globally-by-a-domestic-country-artist-in-the-past-10-years/|title=SELF-TITLED DEBUT ALBUM FROM JADE EAGLESON ON TRACK TO BE MOST STREAMED ALBUM GLOBALLY BY A DOMESTIC COUNTRY ARTIST IN THE PAST 10 YEARS|work=[[Universal Music Canada|Umusic]]|date=July 24, 2020|access-date=January 12, 2021|archive-date=January 20, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210120232835/http://www.umusic.ca/press-releases/self-titled-debut-album-from-jade-eagleson-on-track-to-be-most-streamed-album-globally-by-a-domestic-country-artist-in-the-past-10-years/|url-status=dead}}{{Cite web|url=https://nowandthenmagazine.com/blogs/tim-hick-s-new-single-slide-over-to-be-released-march-31st/posts/jade-eagleson-announces-his-self-entitled-jade-eagleson-debut-album-release-out-now|title=JADE EAGLESON ANNOUNCES HIS SELF ENTITLED ''JADE EAGLESON'' DEBUT ALBUM RELEASE OUT NOW!|work=Now and Then Magazine|access-date=January 12, 2021}} ===2021–present: ''Honkytonk Revival'' and ''Do It Anyway''=== In February 2021, Eagleson independently released the single "[[All Night to Figure It Out]]".{{Cite web|first=Nanci|last=Dagg|url=https://canadianbeats.ca/2021/02/18/jade-eagleson-had-a-breakout-2020-and-2021-is-shaping-up-to-be-awesome-starting-with-the-release-of-his-new-single-all-night-to-figure-it-out/|title=Jade Eagleson had a breakout 2020 and 2021 is shaping up to be awesome starting with the release of his new single "All Night To Figure It Out"|work=Canadian Beats Media|date=February 18, 2021}} It would become his second Number One [[Canada Country]] hit. Shortly after, he released the single "[[More Drinkin' Than Fishin']]", a collaboration with fellow Canadian country artist [[Dean Brody]].{{cite web|url=https://topcountry.ca/top-country-pick-of-the-week-jade-eagleson-dean-brody-more-drinkin-than-fishin/|title=Pick of the Week – Jade Eagleson & Dean Brody "More Drinkin' Than Fishin'"|date=July 25, 2021|work=Top Country}}{{cite web|url=https://cashboxcanada.ca/features-music/jade-eagleson-and-dean-brody-team-new-release-more-drinkin-fishing/4986|title=Jade Eagleson and Dean Brody Team Up for New Release "More Drinkin' than Fishing" |date=July 30, 2021|work=Cashbox Canada}}{{cite web|url=https://www.fyimusicnews.ca/articles/2021/07/29/music-news-digest-july-29-2021|title=Music News Digest, July 29, 2021 |date=July 29, 2021|work=FYI Music News}} On November 12, 2021, Eagleson released his second studio album, ''[[Honkytonk Revival]]'',{{cite web|url=https://www.partonandpearl.com/blog/album-review-jade-eagleson-honkytonk-revival|title=Album Review: Jade Eagleson, Honkytonk Revival|first=Kim|last=Hughes|date=December 8, 2021|work=Parton and Pearl}} which included "All Night to Figure It Out" and "More Drinkin' Than Fishin'" as well as the single "[[She Don't Know]]".{{cite web|url=https://www.cjvr.com/2022/02/04/jade-eagleson-talkes-she-dont-know-and-more/|title=Jade Eagleson Talks "She Don't Know" and more|date=February 4, 2022|first=Cal|last=Gratton|work=CJVR FM|publisher=[[Pattison Media]]}}{{cite web|url= https://frontporchmusic.ca/music/jade-eagleson-wife-she-dont-know/|title= Jade Eagleson And His Wife Talk About Their Love Story And New Single "She Don't Know"|work=Front Porch Music|date=February 22, 2022}}{{cite web|url=https://lonestar923.com/jade-eagleson-she-dont-know/?fr=operanews|title=Jade Eagleson Lays His Heart on the Line With 'She Don't Know' [LISTEN]|work=92.3 Lone Star|first=Natalli|last=Amato|date=February 22, 2022|publisher=Townsquare Media}} As a result of each single off the album reaching number one, Eagleson joined [[Shania Twain]] as the only Canadian country artists to ever land three consecutive chart-toppers from their second studio album. In August 2022, he released the single "[[Shakin' in Them Boots]]".{{cite web|url=https://canadianbeats.ca/2022/08/22/jade-eagleson-releases-new-single-shakin-in-them-boots/|title=Jade Eagleson releases New Single "Shakin' In Them Boots"|first=Migs|last=Lava|date=August 22, 2022|work=Canadian Beats Media|access-date=September 22, 2022}} At the [[2022 Canadian Country Music Awards]], Eagleson was awarded the Top Selling Canadian Album of the Year for ''[[Honkytonk Revival]]'', and received six other nominations. In March 2023, he released the single "[[Rodeo Queen (song)|Rodeo Queen]]".{{cite web|url=https://www.whiskeyriff.com/2023/03/11/jade-eagleson-releases-jukebox-honky-tonk-single-rodeo-queen/|title=Jade Eagleson Releases Jukebox Honky Tonk Single "Rodeo Queen"|first=Mary Claire|last=Crabtree|work=Whiskey Riff|date=March 11, 2023}}{{cite web|url= https://todayscountrymagazine.com/index.php/reviews/single-reviews/2702-single-review-jade-eagleson-rodeo-queen|title=Single Review: Jade Eagleson - "Rodeo Queen"|first=Jeffrey|last=Kurtis|work=Today's Country Magazine|access-date=March 15, 2023}} Both singles are included on his third studio album ''[[Do It Anyway (album)|Do It Anyway]]'', which was released on September 29, 2023.{{cite web|url= https://www.rfdtv.com/jade-eagleson-announces-his-unapologetically-country-album-do-it-anways|title=Jade Eagleson announces his unapologetically country album, Do It Anway|date=August 29, 2023|work=RFDTV|access-date=August 30, 2023}} At the [[2023 Canadian Country Music Awards]], Eagleson was named "Entertainer of the Year" and "Male Artist of the Year". According to [[Mediabase]], he was the most played domestic artist and the eight-most played artist overall on Canadian country radio in 2023.{{cite web|url=https://www2.mediabase.com/mbapp/files/YearEndPdf/2023__YEAR_END_1f3cd348-4b65-43f4-9918-b081ab3219d9.pdf|title=Mediabase Canadian 2023 Year-End Edition|work=[[Mediabase]]|access-date=December 22, 2023}} "[[Telluride (Jade Eagleson song)|Telluride]]" became the fourth radio single off ''Do It Anyway'' in 2024. Later that year, he released a new version of the song "Do It Anyway" featuring American country artist Jake Worthington.{{Cite web|url=https://canadianbeats.ca/2024/07/22/jade-eagleson-shares-do-it-anyway-ft-jake-worthington/|title=Jade Eagleson shares “Do It Anyway” ft. Jake Worthington|first=Nanci|last=Dagg|date=July 22, 2024|access-date=September 23, 2024|work=Canadian Beats Media}} Eagleson won "Album of the Year" at the [[2024 Canadian Country Music Awards]] for ''[[Do It Anyway (album)|Do It Anyway]]''. ==Personal life== Eagleson married his longtime girlfriend Marina Paquin in 2019.{{cite web|first=Katie|last=Colley|title=Jade Eagleson Marries Longtime Girlfriend Marina Paquin|url=https://etcanada.com/news/531008/jade-eagleson-marries-longtime-girlfriend-marina-paquin/amp/ |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20191105074658/https://etcanada.com/news/531008/jade-eagleson-marries-longtime-girlfriend-marina-paquin/amp/ |url-status=dead |archive-date=November 5, 2019 |work=[[Entertainment Tonight Canada|ET Canada]]|date=October 28, 2019}} Later that year, Marina gave birth to their first son.{{cite web|first=Katie|last=Colley|title=Jade Eagleson Welcomes First Child With Wife Marina|url=https://etcanada.com/news/537001/jade-eagleson-welcomes-first-child-with-wife-marina/ |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20191108111950/https://etcanada.com/news/537001/jade-eagleson-welcomes-first-child-with-wife-marina/ |url-status=dead |archive-date=November 8, 2019 |work=[[Entertainment Tonight Canada|ET Canada]]|date=November 7, 2019}} The couple’s second son was born in 2024.{{Cite web|url=https://x.com/jadeeagleson/status/1769162151908856244?s=46|title=George Dean Clarence Eagleson 03/15/24|work=X|date=March 15, 2024}} They currently live in [[Nashville, Tennessee]]. Eagleson met Paquin on the set of the music video for his debut single "[[Got Your Name on It]]".{{Cite web|url=https://www.pressparty.com/pg/newsdesk/umusic/view/220005/|title=Self-titled debut album from Jade Eagleson on track to be most streamed album globally|work=Press Party|date=July 24, 2020}} He considers himself a "proud [[Christian]]".{{cite web|first=Jason|last=Sheppard|title=Jade Eagleson on his career and new single "All Night To Figure It Out"|url=https://www.riverradio.ca/2021/02/jade-eagleson-on-his-career-and-new-single-all-night-to-figure-it-out/|work=River Radio|date=February 14, 2021}}{{Dead link|date=September 2024 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} ==Discography== ===Albums=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" |- !
